question: Which cricket world cup is known as the "Wills World Cup"?
explanation: The 1996 Cricket World Cup is known as the "Wills World Cup". The 1996 Cricket World Cup, also called the Wills World Cup 1996, was the sixth Cricket World Cup, organised by the International Cricket Council (ICC). It was a second World Cup to be hosted by Pakistan and India, and for the first time by Sri Lanka. The tournament was won by Sri Lanka, which defeated Australia in the final at the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore, Pakistan.
